teleworkability.citation: Dingel, J. I., & Neiman, B. (2020). How many jobs can be done at home? Journal of Public Economics, 189, 104235.
teleworkability.variable: Binary indicator (0/1) for whether occupation can be performed remotely
teleworkability.methodology: Classification based on O*NET work context questions about physical presence requirements

automation_risk.citation: Frey, C. B., & Osborne, M. A. (2017). The future of employment: How susceptible are jobs to computerisation? Technological Forecasting and Social Change, 114, 254-280.
automation_risk.variable: Probability of automation (0-1) via pre-GenAI technologies (robotics, traditional ML)
automation_risk.methodology: Machine learning model trained on expert assessments of 70 occupations, extended to 702 occupations
